speaker: Maelle
line: Wait for us here. It’s dangerous for you near Papa. We’ll have to move fast, I can’t maintain them for very long. Tomorrow comes.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father. He’s at the tower.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yes.

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle…

speaker: Sciel
line: Your father’s been extra inspired.

speaker: Monoco
line: A most enticing challenge.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa’s over there. And the chroma we need to bring back Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: Even I can sense him…

speaker: Lune
line: We’d better make sure we’re ready.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa.

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: Please. I just want you to understand what this Canvas means to me-

speaker: Renoir
line: I do understand. I know how powerful and intoxicating it is, how deeply attached we can become to the worlds we pour our hearts and souls into. I was enthralled and it nearly killed me.

speaker: Maelle
line: That doesn’t mean you have to erase Verso’s Canvas!

speaker: Renoir
line: Child, do you think I want to? After all the sorrows we’ve endured, do you really think that I want to destroy that last piece of his soul?

speaker: Maelle
line: Then don’t. Don’t.

speaker: Renoir
line: Life keeps forcing cruel choices. We do what we must.

speaker: Sciel
line: Grief often blinds us. And we make choices we can never take back.

speaker: Renoir
line: You grieve for two.

speaker: Sciel
line: I grieve for many.

speaker: Lune
line: The choices of parents leave indelible marks upon their children. But ultimately, the voices in their head have to be their own. You cannot set the boundaries of their life for them.

speaker: Maelle
line: After the fire—You wanted me to find—new joy in life. And I tried. But I couldn’t. I couldn’t. Verso died because of ME. How do I get from that to joy?

speaker: Renoir
line: Child, it will get better. I promise you. But this is not the way. Your friends speak truth, and it changes nothing. You can hate me, but that’s a choice I must make. As your father, I must look out for you. Especially when you can’t look out for yourself.

speaker: Maelle
line: You treat me as if I’m still five…

speaker: Renoir
line: I treat you as if the shadow from the worst day of our lives is going to suffocate you and take you from us too. Enough. I said enough.
